content: Singaporean parliamentary meeting The **9th Parliament of Singapore** was a meeting of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). Its first session commenced on 26 May 1997 and was prorogued on 8 September 1999. It commenced its second session on 4 October 1999 and was dissolved on 18 October 2001. The members of the 9th Parliament were elected in the [1997 general election](/wiki/1997_Singaporean_general_election). Parliament was controlled by a [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) majority, led by [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister) [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) and his [cabinet](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore). The Speaker was [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon). ## Officeholders - [**Speaker**](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore)**:** [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Deputy Speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore#List_of_deputy_speakers):** - Eugene Yap ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore):** [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Deputy Prime Minister**](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)**:** - [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [Tony Tan](/wiki/Tony_Tan) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Leader of the Opposition**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore))**:** [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) ([SPP](/wiki/Singapore_People%27s_Party)) - [**Leader of the House**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_House_(Singapore)): [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Party Whip of the People's Action Party](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party)**: [Lee Boon Yang](/wiki/Lee_Boon_Yang) - [**Deputy Party Whip of the People's Action Party**](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party#List_of_deputy_party_whips)**:** - Goh Chee Wee - [Ong Chit Chung](/wiki/Ong_Chit_Chung) ## Composition Political partyMembersAt
